case_vignette: A 52-year-old man presents with a 5-week history of multiple cutaneous ulcers on his left forearm and neck, which he first noticed after returning from a 2-month stay in rural Peru. He does not recall any trauma or arthropod bites. The lesions began as non-pruritic erythematous papules that became enlarged, ulcerated, and crusted. There is no history of fever or abdominal pain. He has been sexually active with a single partner since their marriage at 24 years of age. The physical examination reveals erythematous, crusted plaques with central ulceration and a raised border. There is no fluctuance, drainage, or sporotrichoid spread. A punch biopsy was performed, which revealed an ulcerated lesion with a mixed inflammatory infiltrate. Amastigotes within dermal macrophages are seen on Giemsa staining.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

I have multiple open sores on my left forearm and neck that started as red bumps.
Have you noticed any fever or chills recently?
No, I haven't had any fever or chills.
When did you first notice the red bumps that turned into sores?
I first noticed the red bumps that turned into sores five weeks ago.
Do these sores have any discharge or do they appear crusted?
Yes, the sores appear crusted.
Have you been experiencing any itchiness or pain in the area of the sores?
No, the bumps started out not itchy.
Have you been in contact with anyone with similar symptoms or have you been in a situation that might have exposed you to an infection?
No, I don't recall any trauma or insect bites, and I've been sexually active only with my spouse.
Do you have any pre-existing medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
The case vignette provided does not disclose any pre-existing medical conditions or regular medications, so I can't provide that information.
Do you have any allergies or have you used any new skincare or hygiene products recently?
The case vignette does not mention any allergies or the use of new skincare or hygiene products, so I don't have that information.
Have you had any weight changes, night sweats, or felt generally unwell in the past few weeks?
No, I haven't experienced weight changes, night sweats, or a general feeling of being unwell.
Do any members of your family have similar sores or a history of skin conditions?
The case vignette does not provide any information about family members having similar sores or a history of skin conditions.

Final Diagnosis: Non-healing ulcers of unknown etiology, potential differential diagnoses include cutaneous tuberculosis, atypical mycobacterial infection, cutaneous leishmaniasis, or pyoderma gangrenosum. Further diagnostic testing and possible biopsy are necessary.
